boardgame.name: Code 7
Code 777
Tricoda
boardgame.description: The clever little game Code 777 combines the elements of a good, logical deduction game and Indian poker. Each player receives a rack for keeping three tiles drawn from a pool of tiles, which are seven different numbers in seven different colors (28 tiles in total); however, the rack is turned away from you. When players sit in a circle, each player can see everyone else's tiles, except their own. Each turn, players draw a card with a question like, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Do you see more yellow sevens or more blue sevens?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; which should help the others' determine their tiles. Once you're reasonably sure of which tiles you have in front of you, you can take a guess _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; but if you're wrong, you have to start over with a fresh set of tiles..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Code 777 was explicitly inspired by What's That on My Head?, and Alex Randolph credited Robert Abbott with co-designing this game based on that inspiration._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In 2010, Stronghold Games released Code 777: 25th Anniversary Deluxe Edition, adding both a fifth player to the game and symbols to make it colorblind-friendly. In 2015, Stronghold Games released Code 777: 30th Anniversary Limited Edition, which is the final edition from Stronghold Games._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 82 - Interview with Stronghold Games
Ep. 12: The Strongman of Stronghold Games

listing.notes: complete and in excellent conditions (like new) shipping: letter or small package Please look at my site http://de.geocities.com/hauwech_jetzt/shipping.html for further information. Payment: paypal (preferred, add fees)
Played a few times. Lots of sheets left on the pad. Has photocopies of the english question lists.

this is the Jumbo edition of CODE 777. Multilanguage, rules and question cards are available in english, german, french, dutch.... Box is in OK shape, one side has been partially torn and now has some tape on it, otherwise no problem with the box. Barely noticeable, as the content is in VERY GOOD shape. Barely used as the notepad still has almost all its sheets of paper to write down your hints. One rack (to hold the tiles) was missing and I replaced it with another one of similar shape a carpenter espeially made for me. As this game isn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;#039;t very heavy, it can ship for less than $10 regular airmail anywhere in the world. Very hard to find game
Jumbo (Code 777) edition. Box lid shows moderate shelf wear, but is not split or torn. Otherwise complete and contents in good/very good condition.

great opportunity to buy this jewel, in EXCELLENT condition, inside is as good as new, with the notepad barely used. Box has real minor wears due to normal storage condition. Very hard to find, especially in such a good condition. This is the international multilanguage edition, with all you ned to play in french german or english (and more languages)... rules, cards etc. No translation required! Since the game isn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;#039;t very heavy, I can ship it regular airmail for just $10, anywhere in the world.

Brand new. In shrink. Please contact me for a shipping quote.

This is the Chieftain edition, called Code 7. It is essentially identical to the Jumbo edition - the racks are different, but everything else is the same. The rules and cards are in English and French. The game is complete and in very good condition overall. The tiles do show very slight wear, but are not distinguishable from the back except for one which has an extremely small ink mark. This will not be a problem for many people, and if it is you can simply draw the tiles from a bag (having an opponent place them). The box has a little wear.

Stronghold Games (SG1 001) The classic code-cracking game is back in a 25th Anniversary Deluxe Edition! Crack your code first! You can see your opponents_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; codes but not your own. Using questions and logic, try to deduce which three numbers are hidden in front of you. Once you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re reasonably sure, then you can take a guess. But if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re wrong, you have to start over with a fresh set of tiles... This 25th Anniversary Deluxe Edition of Code 777 has been expanded to allow for up to 5 players (from the previous 4 player editions). All of the components have been upgraded to the highest-quality levels. And our Code 777 is also the first edition to be colorblind friendly! Stronghold Games is proud to bring this great deduction game back into print by popular demand after being unavailable for over 10 years worldwide.
